Love You More Each Day is known With the release of A Chinese Ghost Story II, Tsui Hark's film reached a technical peak. The film's visual images are magical and fantastical, successfully blending the new and the classical, the realistic and the supernatural. In the film, Tsui Hark has spared no effort in experimenting with various cinematographic techniques, resulting in a series of computer-aided special effects, in addition to tall ghosts and giant centipede monsters made from physical models. For example, the highlight of the middle section is when Fu Qingfeng slowly rises into mid-air after being poisoned by a monster, Ning Caichen kisses her while spinning against the background of a green light, creating a strange atmosphere that is both sacred and magical. The evil monk Puducihang makes a solemn but bizarre appearance in the guise of Buddha, and the three-dimensional images by computer stunts are unforgettable to the audience. After the battle with the centipede monster, firstly, Zuo Qianhu is attacked by a monster who appears out of nowhere. Then, Yan Chixia uses a series of swordsmanship. Suddenly, the centipede monster pops up from the ground and everyone flies on their swords. And finally, Yan Chixia and Zhi Qiu's spirits leave their bodies and merge into their swords. The flying sword blows up the centipede monster. But Zhi Qiu's spirit cannot go back to his body and disappears in the sky. It's an imaginative and smooth performance.

Love Trilogy is known Love Trilogy: written by Oi Wah Lam, the script explores the various stages of male-female relationships, including the weariness of the couple for the seven-year itch, problems and compromises for the newlywed couple, the worry and confusion for the not-yet married couple. While Sung Kee Chiu, keeps following the three section multiline set-up like in Oh! My Three Guys, The Log and Comeuppance. The stories are self-contained units and intertwined with each other at the same time. Although they are not as rigorous and mature as the previous ones, they are still ingeniously designed. Oi Wah Lam took the trouble to portray the indifference, fragility and sensitivity of love for us, which quite related to the audience and added a vigilant chill. Well, Oi Wah Lam's love narratives are usually full of light and delicate literary feel. The director sung Kee Chiu is not only good at controlling the set-up, but also committed to the handling of details. Specifically, in Love Trilogy, the most typical is to use repetition to express the details.

The Swordsman is known Swordman: Based on Jin Yong's original martial arts novel, Swordman is a King Hu style story where loyal and kind people are framed by a eunuch of Dongchang. It also has Tsui Hark style cynical criticism over politics and Ching Siu Tung's impressive design for action scenes. It is recognized by most of the fans and is called by critics as a model of "new martial arts films". The success of the film is largely attributed to Tsui Hark and Ching Siu Tung, but the performances of Xu Guanjie, Ye Tong, Jacky Cheung, Zhang Min and Liu Xun as leading characters also contribute to the film's success. Xu Guanjie's s free, casual and elegant bearing is considered to be the most true interpretation of the original Linhu Chong. In addition, Jacky Cheung and Liu Xun's roles as eunuchs of Dongchang can definitely be described as perfect.

The Assassin is known The Assassin focuses more on the visual effects. It is filmed on location in Shennongjia, Wudang Mountain, Inner Mongolia and many other places. The natural scenery of different places perfect this movie visually. A shot taken from indoor to outdoor contrasts the indoor scenes and the outdoor scenes, which respectively are the noble house of the ministers and fairyland-like rural scenery. Reset is known The film is packed with intense action scenes, including a highway chase, a dangerous explosion in a laboratory, a close-quarter fight on a high wire, and a fierce shootout at an abandoned school. The audience's eyes just cannot take it all. In addition to surprising science-fiction plots, intense action scenes and impressive characters, this film about the rescue of a son by reversing time and space also brings many people to tears. Underneath the surface of soft science-fiction, Reset discusses a topic that many people face today - how to control time as they wish. In the film, Mi Yang is forced to travel back in time, but this leads to a series of troubles and pains.
